Environmental regulations

Burning waste regulations: A easy way to get rid of the waste is to burn it, however it releases very harmful chemicals for the environment and for the people, that said, it is illegal in Cork. If you do not follow tis regulation you might pay a fine of up to €3,000. If you see any person burning waste, please phone at 021-4924000

Packaging regulations

Cork being part of the Irish market follow The European Union Packaging Regulations 2014 which promotes all producers, importers, distributors, and retailers to *minimize weight and volume at only the amount needed for safety *Packages must be able to be recycled after their use, in methods such as, energy recovery, composting or reuse.*Levels of specified noxious materials must not exceed 100 parts per million

Food Waste regulations

Householders have the obligation to separe their food waste in a separated bin (brown bin), and bring it to an authoraised tratment facility, of use it as compost. The major food waste commercial producers also have to ensure this food is collected in a separated brown bin and not mixed with others.
